Barcode.title: Bulk Barcode Generator (Excel Support)
Barcode.subtitle:
Create various types of barcodes quickly and easily.
 Copy and paste Excel data to create hundreds of barcodes at once.

whyUse.title: Why use this barcode generator?
whyUse.desc: When you need a barcode for business or personal use, you don't need to install complex software or pay for services. This Online Barcode Generator is available instantly, anytime, anywhere, with just a web browser.

speed.title: ‚ö° High-Speed Bulk Generation
speed.desc: Just copy and paste data from Excel or spreadsheets. Dozens or hundreds of barcodes are created instantly.

format.title: üé® Various Formats Supported
format.desc: Fully supports 16 standard formats, from the widely used CODE128 to EAN-13 for products and ITF for logistics.

security.title: üîí Secure & Safe
security.desc: All barcode generation happens within your browser. No data is sent to the server, so you can use it with confidence.

code128.title: 1. CODE128 (Standard Barcode)
code128.desc: The most widely used barcode format. It can include uppercase/lowercase letters, numbers, and special symbols, making it popular for logistics, inventory, and invoices. If you're unsure what to use, choose CODE128.

qrcode.title: 2. QR Code
qrcode.desc: A 2D barcode that can hold large amounts of data like URLs, contact info, or Wi-Fi details. Useful for connecting to websites via smartphone scanning.

ean13.title: 3. EAN-13 (Product Barcode)
ean13.desc: The standard barcode attached to retail products worldwide. It consists of 13 digits and is mandatory for items sold in convenience stores or supermarkets.

itf.title: 4. ITF (Interleaved 2 of 5)
itf.desc: A high-density numeric-only barcode, mainly used for corrugated boxes or logistics printing. It has high recognition rates even with poor print quality.

instruction.title: How to Use
instruction.step1: Select Format: Choose the type of barcode you want to create. For general use, choose 'CODE128'; for website links, choose 'QR Code'.

step2.title: Enter Data:
step2.sub1: Individual: Enter content in the input box and click 'Add'.
step2.sub2: Bulk: Turn on 'Bulk Input', paste data copied from Excel, and click 'Bulk Generate'.

instruction.step3: Adjust Options: Adjust width, height, margins, etc., to create your desired design.
instruction.step4: Download & Print: Save the generated barcodes as images or print them directly.

limit.q: Q. Are there any usage limits?
limit.a: It is free for everyone, including commercial use. All features are available without signup or payment.

expiry.a: No, generated barcodes are image files and can be used permanently as long as they are scannable.

korean.q: Q. Can I make barcodes with Korean text?
korean.a: QR codes fully support Korean text. However, 1D barcodes like CODE128 or EAN-13 typically support only English and numbers.

batch.q: Q. How do I convert Excel data at once?
batch.a: Drag and copy (Ctrl+C) the cells you want to convert in Excel, then paste (Ctrl+V) them into the input box on this site. It automatically recognizes line-separated data and generates multiple barcodes at once.

generator.placeholderExcel: Paste data copied from Excel here
generator.errorEanInvalid: EAN barcode must be 12 or 13 digits
generator.errorEan8Invalid: EAN-8 barcode must be 7 or 8 digits
generator.errorUpcInvalid: UPC barcode must be 11 or 12 digits
generator.errorBulkMax: Exceeds maximum limit. Current: {current}, Adding: {added}, Max: {max}

QRGenerator.title: QR Code Generator - Free Online QR Code Maker
QRGenerator.subtitle:
Convert URLs, text, and contact info to QR codes.
Customize colors and download in high resolution - all for free.
QRGenerator.placeholderValue: Enter URL, text, contact info, etc.
QRGenerator.emptyState: Enter content above to generate a QR code
QRGenerator.errorEmpty: Please enter content to convert to QR code
QRGenerator.placeholderBulk: Paste data copied from Excel (one per line)

whyUse.title: Why use this QR code generator?
whyUse.desc: Generate QR codes for free directly in your web browser without installing any apps. Color customization, high-resolution download, and bulk generation - all features are free.

useCases.title: QR Code Use Cases
useCases.contact: Exchange business cards and contact info

free.q: Q. Is the QR code generator free?
free.a: Yes, it's completely free. You can generate and download unlimited QR codes without registration.

expiry.q: Q. Do generated QR codes expire?
expiry.a: No, generated QR codes are image files and can be used permanently.

korean.q: Q. Can I include Korean text in QR codes?
korean.a: Yes, QR codes support all text including Korean, English, numbers, special characters, and URLs.

color.q: Q. Can I change the QR code color?
color.a: Yes, you can freely change the foreground and background colors. Just maintain enough contrast.

bulk.q: Q. Can I create multiple QR codes at once?
bulk.a: Yes, on PC you can paste Excel data to generate multiple QR codes at once.

meta.title: Real-time Exchange Rate Calculator | USD JPY EUR Converter | Tani DevTool
meta.description: Calculate real-time exchange rates for major currencies worldwide. Essential exchange rate info for USD, EUR, JPY, CNY for travel and shopping.
meta.keywords: exchange rate calculator, currency converter, usd rate, jpy rate, eur rate, exchange calculator
meta.ogTitle: Real-time Exchange Rate Calculator
meta.ogDescription: Check real-time exchange rates before travel or shopping.

MoneyConverter.title: Exchange Rate Calculator
MoneyConverter.description:
Check exchange rates of major currencies at a glance.
Accurate rates updated daily.

client.noData: Exchange rate data is not available today (Weekend/Holiday).

definition.title: What is an Exchange Rate Calculator?
definition.desc: An exchange rate calculator is an online tool that compares and converts currency values between different countries in real time. This calculator uses official standard rates from the Export-Import Bank of Korea and supports over 40 currencies including USD, EUR, JPY, and CNY. It helps you accurately convert amounts for travel, international shopping, remittances, and study abroad expenses. Note that data may not be updated on non-business days (weekends and Korean holidays).

case1.title: Travel Budget Planning
case1.desc: Plan your total travel budget by calculating accommodation, transportation, and meal costs in local currency before your trip. For example, instantly check how much 100,000 KRW converts to Japanese Yen for a trip to Japan, helping you decide the right amount and timing for currency exchange.

case2.title: International Shopping Price Comparison
case2.desc: Check the actual KRW price of products on international shopping sites like Amazon and Taobao. Calculate the final cost including shipping and customs duties to make smart purchasing decisions by comparing with domestic prices.

case3.title: Overseas Remittance & Study Abroad Costs
case3.desc: Accurately check the KRW equivalent of monthly tuition and living expenses you need to remit. Monitor exchange rate fluctuations to send money at favorable rates, potentially saving significant amounts and helping with long-term financial planning.

steps.step1: Select Currency: Choose your desired currency from the dropdown in each row. Supports 40+ currencies including USD, EUR, JPY, and more.
steps.step2: Enter Amount: Enter an amount in any row, and the other currencies will be automatically calculated using real-time exchange rates.
steps.step3: Compare Results: View converted amounts for all currencies at a glance. Useful for travel budgeting or comparing international prices.

update.q: How often is the exchange rate updated?
update.a: This service uses the Export-Import Bank of Korea API, updated around 11 AM on business days (KST). Data is not updated on weekends and Korean holidays.

actual.q: Can I exchange money at the rate shown here?
actual.a: The displayed rate is the standard rate for reference only. Actual exchange rates vary by bank's preferential rates and fees. Please check with your bank for actual rates.

jpy100.a: Japanese Yen is quoted per 100 units due to its small value. For example, if JPY(100) = 900 KRW, then 1 JPY ‚âà 9 KRW.

save.q: How can I save on exchange fees?
save.a: Use bank mobile apps (up to 90% discount), visit private exchange offices in Korea, or use travel cards like Travel Wallet for fee-free transactions abroad.

pair.metaDesc: Convert {fromName} ({fromCode}) to {toName} ({toCode}) with today's live exchange rate. Based on official Korea Exim Bank standard rates.
pair.keywords: {fromCode} to {toCode}, {fromName} to {toName} exchange rate, {fromCode} rate, {toCode} rate, {fromCode} {toCode} converter
pair.ogDesc: Convert {fromName} to {toName} with real-time exchange rates.
pair.noData: Exchange rate data is not available today (Weekend/Holiday).
pair.definition: The exchange rate between {fromName} ({fromCode}) and {toName} ({toCode}) represents the conversion ratio between the two currencies. This calculator provides real-time exchange rate information based on the official standard rates from the Export-Import Bank of Korea.
pair.howToStep1: Enter the amount you want to convert
pair.howToStep2: Real-time exchange rates are applied automatically
pair.howToStep3: Check the result and copy it to clipboard
pair.howToStep4: Use the swap button to reverse the conversion direction
pair.useCase1Desc: Check the exact amount when exchanging {fromName} to {toName} to plan your travel budget accurately.
pair.useCase2Desc: Check the {fromCode}/{toCode} rate to send money at the most favorable time.
pair.useCase3Desc: Convert {fromName} prices to {toName} when shopping internationally to understand the actual cost.
pair.faq1q: Where is the best place to exchange {fromCode} to {toCode}?
pair.faq1a: Bank mobile apps (up to 90% fee discount), private exchange offices, and travel cards offer competitive exchange rates.
pair.faq2q: How often does the {fromCode}/{toCode} exchange rate change?
pair.faq2a: Exchange rates fluctuate in real-time on the foreign exchange market. Our data is updated around 11 AM KST on business days.
pair.faq3q: Can I make actual transactions at the displayed rate?
pair.faq3a: The displayed rate is the standard rate for reference purposes. Actual exchange rates may differ based on bank fees and preferential rates.
pair.faq4q: Can I check exchange rates on weekends or holidays?
pair.faq4a: Yes, you can check rates, but new rates are not posted on weekends/holidays, so the most recent business day rate is displayed.
pair.faq5q: What factors affect the {fromCode} exchange rate?
pair.faq5a: Interest rate differentials, trade balance, economic indicators, political situations, and global events all influence exchange rate fluctuations.
pair.faq6q: How can I get preferential exchange rates?
pair.faq6a: Use bank mobile app exchanges, primary bank benefits, large-volume exchanges, and exchange rate alert services for better rates.
pair.noticeText: Exchange rate information is based on the standard rates from the Export-Import Bank of Korea and may differ from actual exchange rates. Please verify with financial institutions directly for investment decisions or large transactions.

pension.title: üí∞ National Pension (4.5%)
pension.desc: Pension for retirement security. Company and employee each pay 4.5%, totaling 9%.

health.title: üè• Health Insurance (3.545%)
health.desc: Insurance for medical expenses. Long-term care insurance (12.27% of health insurance) is added.

employment.title: üíº Employment Insurance (0.9%)
employment.desc: Insurance for unemployment benefits. Employee pays 0.9%.

nonTaxable.q: Q. What is a non-taxable amount?
nonTaxable.a: Salary items not subject to tax. Examples include meal allowance (up to 200k KRW) and childcare allowance. Higher non-taxable amounts mean lower tax and higher net pay.

severance.a: If 'Included', annual salary is divided by 13 (12 for monthly pay, 1 for severance). So monthly net pay is lower than 'Excluded' (salary / 12).

meta.title: Interest Calculator | Deposit & Savings Simple/Compound Calculator
meta.description: Essential for savings planning! Compare simple vs compound interest and calculate after-tax returns. Enter monthly deposit, period, and rate to see maturity amount.
meta.keywords: interest calculator, savings calculator, deposit calculator, simple vs compound, compound interest calculator
meta.ogTitle: Interest Calculator | Simple vs Compound Interest
meta.ogDescription: How much will my money grow? Calculate your savings maturity amount in advance.

InterestCalculator.title: Interest Calculator (Deposit/Savings)
InterestCalculator.subtitle:
Start maximizing your savings!
Compare deposit and savings interest with simple and compound calculations.

info.title: Simple vs Compound Interest?
info.simpleDesc: Interest is calculated only on the principal amount. Interest earned is not reinvested, so the interest amount remains constant each period.
info.compoundDesc: Interest is added to the principal, and future interest is calculated on the new total. This creates the 'compounding effect' where your money grows faster over time.

tips.title: üí° Investment Tips
tips.desc: For short-term (under 1 year) savings, the difference between simple and compound interest is small. However, for long-term (3+ years) investments, compound interest is significantly more advantageous. Utilizing tax-advantaged savings accounts can also save on the 15.4% interest income tax.

difference.q: What is the difference between simple and compound interest?
difference.a: Simple interest is calculated only on the principal, so interest stays the same each period. Compound interest is calculated on principal plus accumulated interest, growing exponentially over time.

tax.q: What is the interest income tax rate?
tax.a: In Korea, the standard interest income tax is 15.4% (14% income tax + 1.4% local tax). Tax-free or tax-advantaged products may have different rates.

which.q: Which is better: savings account or time deposit?
which.a: If you have a lump sum, time deposits earn more interest. For monthly savings, installment savings help build saving habits. Choose based on your situation.

compound.q: Do monthly compound interest products actually exist?
compound.a: Most bank deposits use simple interest. Monthly compounding is mainly offered by CMA accounts and some special financial products. Always check product details before signing up.

taxfree.a: Tax-free comprehensive savings accounts allow eligible individuals (aged 65+, persons with disabilities, etc.) to save without the 15.4% interest income tax. Up to 50 million KRW per person can be deposited, and all interest is received in full ‚Äî more favorable than standard taxed products.

earlyWithdraw.q: What happens to interest if I withdraw early?
earlyWithdraw.a: If you break your deposit/savings before maturity, a reduced early withdrawal rate applies instead of the agreed rate. It typically drops to less than half the original rate, and shorter holding periods result in even lower rates. To avoid early withdrawal, keep an emergency fund separate.

definition.title: What is Interest Calculation?
definition.desc: Interest is the cost of borrowing money or the return for depositing money. When you open a savings account at a bank, the bank uses your funds and pays interest as compensation. Higher rates, longer periods, and compound methods yield more interest.

formula.title: Interest Formulas
formula.simple: Simple Interest = Principal √ó Annual Rate √ó Period (years)
formula.compound: Compound Maturity = Principal √ó (1 + Annual Rate √∑ 12) ^ Months
formula.savings: Savings Simple Interest = Monthly Deposit √ó Months √ó (Months+1) √∑ 2 √ó (Annual Rate √∑ 12)
formula.note: ‚Äª Interest income tax of 15.4% (14% income tax + 1.4% local tax) is withheld from interest.

guide.title: How to Use the Interest Calculator

1.label: STEP 1. Select Calculation Type
1.desc: Choose between Deposit (lump sum placed at once) and Savings (monthly installment deposits).

2.label: STEP 2. Select Interest Type
2.desc: Choose between Simple Interest (interest on principal only) and Compound Interest (interest on principal + accumulated interest, monthly compounding).

3.label: STEP 3. Enter Amount
3.desc: For deposits, enter the lump sum principal. For savings, enter the monthly installment amount.

4.label: STEP 4. Enter Period and Rate
4.desc: Enter the savings period (in months) and annual interest rate (%). Check the product details for the exact rate.

5.label: STEP 5. View Results
5.desc: Click 'Calculate Interest' to see total principal, pre-tax interest, interest income tax (15.4%), and final after-tax payout at a glance.

case1.title: Compare Returns Before Opening an Account
case1.desc: When comparing deposit/savings products from different banks, interest rates alone don't tell the full story. Use the calculator to compare maturity amounts after tax and choose the most advantageous product.

case2.title: See the Real Difference: Simple vs Compound
case2.desc: Curious about how much simple and compound interest actually differ? Calculate both under the same conditions. For long-term savings (3+ years), the power of compounding becomes clearly visible ‚Äî useful data for your investment strategy.

case3.title: Plan Savings for a Target Amount
case3.desc: If you have a specific financial goal ‚Äî wedding fund, housing deposit, or tuition ‚Äî adjust the monthly amount and period to see if you can reach your target. Helps you create a realistic savings plan.

notice.title: Disclaimer
notice.content: Results from this calculator are for reference only and may differ from actual bank product calculations. Please consult your bank for exact maturity amounts. Tax rate is based on standard taxation (15.4%); tax-free or tax-advantaged products have different rates.

meta.title: Severance Pay Calculator | Retirement Allowance Estimate
meta.description: Calculate your estimated severance pay by entering join/leave dates and recent salary. Accurate calculation for statutory retirement allowance for 1+ years of service.
meta.keywords: severance calculator, retirement pay, severance eligibility, korea severance pay, labor standards act
meta.ogTitle: Severance Pay Calculator | How much will I get?
meta.ogDescription: Check before you leave! Calculate your estimated severance pay in 1 minute.

SeveranceCalculator.title: Severance Pay Calculator
SeveranceCalculator.subtitle:
Planning to leave? Check your retirement benefit.
Easily calculate estimated severance pay by entering your dates.

input.baseSalaryDesc: * Sum of monthly salary + allowances received during the 3 months prior to resignation
input.alertInput: Please enter join date, resignation date, and 3-month salary total.
input.alertPeriod: Employees with less than 1 year of continuous service are not eligible for severance pay.

result.title: Estimated Severance Pay
result.disclaimer: * This is an estimate. Actual amount may vary depending on company regulations and tax deductions.

list.1: More than 1 Year Service: Continuous employment period from join to resignation must be at least 1 year.
list.2: 15+ Hours/Week: Average weekly working hours over a 4-week period must be 15 hours or more.
list.3: Employee Status: Contract workers and part-timers are eligible if they meet the above conditions.

1.title: 1+ Year Continuous Service
1.desc: Period from join date to leave date must be at least 1 full year.

2.title: 15+ Hours/Week
2.desc: Average weekly working hours must be 15 hours or more over a 4-week period.

3.title: All Employment Types
3.desc: Full-time, contract, and part-time workers are all eligible if conditions are met.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.q1: Q. How is severance pay calculated?
faq.a1: Severance Pay = Average Daily Wage √ó 30 days √ó (Service days √∑ 365). The average daily wage is calculated by dividing the total wages for the 3 months before resignation (including base salary, allowances, bonuses, and leave pay) by the total number of days in those 3 months (approximately 91 days).
faq.q2: Q. Can part-time or contract workers receive severance pay?
faq.a2: Yes, they can. Regardless of employment type (full-time, contract, or part-time), workers who have been continuously employed for more than 1 year and worked an average of 15+ hours per week over a 4-week period are entitled to severance pay under the Labor Standards Act.
faq.q3: Q. Are bonuses and annual leave pay included in the calculation?
faq.a3: Yes, they are included. 3/12 (three months' worth) of annual bonuses and 3/12 of annual leave allowance are factored into the average wage calculation. In this calculator, simply enter the amounts in the 'Total Annual Bonus' and 'Annual Leave Allowance' fields to have them automatically reflected.
faq.q4: Q. What is the deadline for severance pay payment?
faq.a4: Employers must pay severance within 14 days of the employee's resignation date. Late payment incurs penalty interest at 20% per annum. However, the deadline may be extended by mutual agreement between the employer and employee.
faq.q5: Q. Can I get an interim settlement (mid-term withdrawal)?
faq.a5: In principle, interim settlement of severance pay is prohibited. However, exceptions are allowed for legally specified reasons such as purchasing a home (for non-homeowners), paying rent deposits, medical care for the employee or dependents lasting 6+ months, or natural disasters.
faq.q6: Q. Is severance pay subject to taxation?
faq.a6: Yes, severance pay is subject to retirement income tax. The tax is calculated based on your years of service and total severance amount, with longer service periods receiving greater deduction benefits. The amount shown in this calculator is pre-tax, so your actual take-home amount will be lower after tax deductions.

definition.title: What is Severance Pay?
definition.desc: Severance pay is a statutory benefit required under Korea's Employee Retirement Benefit Security Act. Employers must pay severance to any employee who has worked continuously for 1 year or more upon their resignation or retirement. This applies to all employment types, including full-time, contract, and part-time workers, as long as they meet the eligibility requirements.

formula.title: Severance Pay Formula
formula.line1: Average Daily Wage = Total wages for 3 months before resignation √∑ Total days in those 3 months (91 days)
formula.line2: Severance Pay = Average Daily Wage √ó 30 days √ó (Total service days √∑ 365 days)
formula.note: ‚Äª Total wages include base salary, allowances, bonuses (3/12 of annual bonus), and annual leave allowance (3/12 of annual leave pay).

guide.title: How to Use the Severance Pay Calculator

1.label: STEP 1. Select Join Date
1.desc: In the 'Work Period' section at the top, click the left date field and select the date you first joined the company. Use the start date on your employment contract as the reference.

2.label: STEP 2. Select Resignation Date
2.desc: Click the right date field and select your planned resignation date. The resignation date means the day after your last working day. For example, if you worked until December 31st, enter January 1st.

3.label: STEP 3. Enter 3-Month Total Salary
3.desc: In the 'Salary Information' section, enter your total pre-tax salary for the last 3 months in the main input field. This is the sum of your base salary plus fixed allowances (meal, transport, etc.) for 3 months. Example: If your monthly salary is 3 million KRW, enter 9,000,000.

4.label: STEP 4. Enter Bonus & Leave Allowance (Optional)
4.desc: If you received bonuses or annual leave allowance, enter them in the two smaller fields below. For bonus, enter the total annual amount (e.g., combined holiday bonuses). For leave allowance, enter compensation for unused annual leave days. You can leave these blank if not applicable.

5.label: STEP 5. Click 'Calculate Severance Pay'
5.desc: After entering all information, click the 'Calculate Severance Pay' button at the bottom. Join date, resignation date, and 3-month salary are required fields. If your service period is less than 1 year, a notification will appear that you are not eligible for severance pay.

6.label: STEP 6. View Results
6.desc: Once calculated, the estimated severance pay amount and total service period (XX years XX months) will be displayed in the result card. This is a pre-tax estimate; your actual amount may differ after retirement income tax deductions.

case1.title: Check Expected Severance Before Resigning
case1.desc: If you're planning to resign or change jobs, use the severance calculator to estimate your payout in advance. This is essential information for financial planning, including living expenses and job search period funds. Check your recent payslips for accurate 3-month salary figures to get more precise results.

case2.title: Verify Eligibility for Part-time & Contract Workers
case2.desc: Many part-time and contract workers are unaware they may be entitled to severance pay. If you've worked for more than 1 year and at least 15 hours per week, you're eligible regardless of employment type. Enter your work period and salary in the calculator to instantly check your eligibility and estimated amount.

case3.title: Compare Total Compensation When Changing Jobs
case3.desc: When you receive a job offer, calculate the severance pay you would receive from your current employer as part of your total compensation package. By factoring in your current severance pay plus unused annual leave allowance, you can make a more informed comparison with the new employer's offer.

notice.title: Important Notice
notice.content: This calculator provides estimates only. Actual severance pay may vary depending on company policies and collective agreements. For accurate calculation, please contact your HR department or the Ministry of Employment and Labor (1350).

meta.title: International Age Calculator | Korean Age & D-Day
meta.description: Calculate your International Age, Year Age, and Korean Age just by entering your birthdate. Accurate age calculation and birthday D-Day check.
meta.keywords: age calculator, korean age calculator, international age, year age, zodiac calculator, d-day calculator
meta.ogTitle: International Age Calculator | What is my Korean Age?
meta.ogDescription: Confused about age calculation? Check your exact International and Korean age.

KoreanAgeCalculator.title: International & Korean Age Calculator
KoreanAgeCalculator.subtitle:
Confused about your age in Korea?
Compare International Age, Year Age, and Korean Age at a glance.

man.title: üéÇ International Age (Man Age)
man.desc: Starts at 0 from birth and adds 1 year on every birthday. This is the global standard and legal standard in Korea since June 2023.

year.title: üìÖ Year Age
year.desc: Current Year - Birth Year. Used in some laws like Military Service Act and Youth Protection Act (buying alcohol/tobacco).

korean.title: üá∞üá∑ Korean Age (Counting Age)
korean.desc: Starts at 1 from birth and adds 1 year on every January 1st. Still commonly used in daily life in Korea.

difference.q: What is the difference between International Age and Korean Age?
difference.a: International Age starts at 0 at birth and adds 1 on each birthday. Korean Age starts at 1 at birth and adds 1 every January 1st. So Korean Age is typically 1-2 years older than International Age.

law.q: What is Korea's 2023 Age Unification Law?
law.a: Since June 28, 2023, Korea unified legal age to 'International Age' (Man-nai). Contracts, official documents, and legal applications now use International Age as the standard.

yearAge.a: Year Age (Current Year - Birth Year) is used in some Korean laws like Military Service Act (determining conscription eligibility) and Youth Protection Act (alcohol/tobacco purchase age).

global.q: How do other countries calculate age?
global.a: Most countries use International Age. The Korean counting age system is quite unique - only a few East Asian countries had similar traditions historically.

meta.title: Emoji Collection | Copy & Paste Special Characters
meta.description: A collection of various emojis and special characters for Instagram, Facebook, and blogs. Copy and paste easily with one click. Categorized by hearts, faces, animals, etc.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: Old devices or browsers may not support the latest emojis and display them as boxes. Try updating your OS or browser to the latest version.
faq.q2: Q. Can I use them commercially?
faq.a2: Emojis are Unicode standard characters and can be used freely like text. However, using the emoji design (font) itself as a logo may require checking the copyright policy of the platform (Apple, Google, etc.).
faq.q3: Q. How can I type emojis on PC?
faq.a3: On Windows, press Windows key + .(Period). On Mac, press Control + Command + Space to open the emoji picker.
faq.q4: Q. The same emoji looks different on different devices.
faq.a4: While emojis follow Unicode standards, the actual designs vary by platform (Apple, Google, Samsung, etc.). The same emoji code may look different depending on your device.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.q1: Q. How many kilometers is 1 mile?
faq.a1: 1 mile is approximately 1.609 km. To roughly convert miles to kilometers, multiply by 1.6.
faq.q2: Q. How do I convert Celsius to Fahrenheit?
faq.a2: Celsius to Fahrenheit: (Celsius √ó 9/5) + 32. For example, 25¬∞C equals 77¬∞F. Fahrenheit to Celsius: (Fahrenheit - 32) √ó 5/9.
faq.q3: Q. How many kilograms is 1 pound?
faq.a3: 1 pound (lb) is approximately 0.454 kg. Conversely, 1 kg is approximately 2.2 pounds.
faq.q4: Q. How many centimeters is 1 inch?
faq.a4: 1 inch is exactly 2.54 cm. This unit is commonly used for TV and monitor screen sizes.

Convert and compare various storage units in real-time.

info.title: Understanding File Size Units
info.note: * Computers use binary system where 1KB = 1,024B. (Hard drive manufacturers often use 1,000-based calculation)

faq.title: FAQ
faq.a1: 1GB equals 1,024MB. Computers use binary (base-2), so calculations are based on 1,024 (2^10) rather than 1,000.
faq.a2: 1TB equals 1,024GB. Terabytes are commonly used for large hard drives and cloud storage.
faq.q3: Q. Why does my hard drive show less space than advertised?
faq.a3: Hard drive manufacturers calculate 1GB = 1,000MB, while operating systems (Windows) use 1GB = 1,024MB. This difference causes the displayed capacity to appear smaller.
faq.q4: Q. What's the difference between KB and KiB?
faq.a4: KB (kilobyte) is 1,000 bytes, while KiB (kibibyte) is 1,024 bytes. This tool uses the 1,024-based calculation commonly used in computing.

info.title: What is Base64?
info.desc: Base64 is an encoding scheme that converts binary data into ASCII string format. It uses 64 characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9, +, /) to represent data and is widely used for safely transmitting binary data in email attachments, web APIs, and data transfer.

api.title: API Authentication
api.desc: HTTP Basic Auth encodes username:password in Base64 for transmission.

image.title: Image Embedding
image.desc: Used to embed images directly in HTML/CSS as Data URIs.

email.title: Email Attachments
email.desc: MIME format converts binary attachments to text.

jwt.title: JWT Tokens
jwt.desc: JSON Web Token headers and payloads are Base64 encoded.

q1.a: No, Base64 is encoding, not encryption. Anyone can easily decode it, so it's not suitable for protecting sensitive data. It should only be used for data format conversion purposes.

q2.a: URL-Safe Base64 is a variant that replaces unsafe URL characters (+, /, =) with safe characters (-, _). It's useful when using Base64 strings in URL parameters or filenames.

q3.q: Q. Why does Base64 encoding increase size?
q3.a: Base64 converts 6 bits into 8-bit ASCII characters, so the encoded data size increases by approximately 33%. (3 bytes ‚Üí 4 characters)

ImageCompressor.title: Image Compressor
ImageCompressor.subtitle: Reduce image file size! Compressed safely in your browser without server upload.

bulk.desc: Upload and compress multiple images at once.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.q1: Q. Will compression reduce image quality?
faq.a1: With 80%+ quality setting, the difference is barely noticeable. You get much smaller files while maintaining clean images.
faq.q2: Q. What format are compressed images saved in?
faq.a2: Compressed images are saved as JPEG format, which provides the most efficient compression for photos.
faq.q3: Q. Can I compress transparent PNG images?
faq.a3: PNG transparency is replaced with white background when converting to JPEG. Keep the original PNG if transparency is needed.

Essential for web design and CSS styling!

hex.title: üé® HEX (Hexadecimal)
hex.desc: Uses # followed by 6 hexadecimal digits (00-FF) representing Red, Green, Blue values. Example: #FF5733 means R=255, G=87, B=51.

rgb.title: üî¥üü¢üîµ RGB (Red, Green, Blue)
rgb.desc: Represents colors using Red, Green, Blue values ranging from 0-255. Commonly used in CSS. Example: rgb(255, 87, 51).

hsl.title: üåà HSL (Hue, Saturation, Lightness)
hsl.desc: Defines colors using Hue (0-360¬∞), Saturation (0-100%), Lightness (0-100%). Intuitive for adjusting color brightness and intensity.

tips.title: üí° Tips for Web Designers
tips.desc: For web accessibility, maintain a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1 between text and background. Using HSL makes it easy to create variations of the same color by simply adjusting saturation and lightness values.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: Q. What is a HEX color code?
faq.a1: HEX (hexadecimal) represents colors using base-16 numbers in #RRGGBB format. Each pair represents Red, Green, Blue from 00-FF (0-255). Example: #FF0000 is pure red.
faq.q2: Q. What's the difference between RGB and HSL?
faq.a2: RGB defines colors by mixing Red, Green, and Blue values. HSL uses Hue (color type), Saturation (intensity), and Lightness (brightness), making it more intuitive for color adjustments.
faq.q3: Q. Which color format should I use for web?
faq.a3: CSS supports HEX, RGB, and HSL. HEX is compact and commonly used, RGB is great with alpha transparency, and HSL is useful when you need to adjust colors programmatically.
faq.q4: Q. How do I copy color codes?
faq.a4: Click the copy button next to any color format (HEX, RGB, HSL) to copy it to your clipboard. You can then paste it directly into CSS or design tools.

meta.description: Free online tool to safely encode or decode URLs with special characters. Supports encodeURIComponent and encodeURI methods. Essential for developers and marketers!
meta.keywords: URL encoder, URL decoder, URL converter, percent encoding, encodeURIComponent, encodeURI, URL encoding, URL decoding
meta.ogTitle: URL Encoder/Decoder | Online URL Conversion Tool
meta.ogDescription: Easily encode or decode URLs with special characters. Free online tool!

UrlEncoder.title: URL Encoder/Decoder
UrlEncoder.subtitle:
Safely encode or decode URLs with special characters and non-ASCII text.
Perfect for web development, API testing, and marketing link creation.

placeholder.encode: Enter URL or text to encode...

error.encode: Error during encoding. Please check your input.
error.decode: Error during decoding. Please verify it's a valid URL encoding.

info.title: What is URL Encoding?
info.desc: URL encoding (percent encoding) converts characters that cannot be used in URLs (non-ASCII characters, special characters, spaces) into safe ASCII format using %XX notation. This allows any character to be safely included in a URL.

component.title: encodeURIComponent (Recommended)
component.desc: Use for query parameter values. Encodes all special characters (:, /, ?, #, etc.) for safety.

uri.title: encodeURI
uri.desc: Use for complete URLs. Preserves URL structure characters (:, /, ?, #) and only encodes non-ASCII characters.

queryParam.title: Query Parameters
queryParam.desc: Encode search terms or filter values when passing them as URL parameters.

api.title: API Requests
api.desc: Use when sending data containing special characters to REST APIs.

form.title: Form Data
form.desc: HTML forms automatically encode data when submitted via GET method.

share.title: Share Links
share.desc: Encode titles or descriptions with special characters for social media sharing.

q1.q: Q. Why is URL encoding necessary?
q1.a: URLs were originally designed to use only ASCII characters. To include special characters or non-ASCII text in URLs, they must be converted to %XX format so browsers and servers can process them correctly.

q2.a: In URL paths, spaces are encoded as %20. In form data (application/x-www-form-urlencoded), spaces may be represented as +. Generally, using %20 is safer.

q3.q: Q. Should I use encodeURIComponent or encodeURI?
q3.a: Use encodeURIComponent when encoding query parameter values. Use encodeURI for complete URLs, but in most cases, encodeURIComponent is safer.

q4.q: Q. Is it a problem if URLs become long with %XX encoding?
q4.a: Long encoded URLs work fine functionally. Browsers display them decoded in the address bar for readability. However, some older systems may have URL length limits.

CharacterCounter.title: Character Counter
CharacterCounter.subtitle: Enter text to count characters with/without spaces, bytes, and words in real-time.

withSpace.title: Characters with Spaces
withSpace.desc: Total character count including spaces and line breaks. Used for general document writing.

withoutSpace.title: Characters without Spaces
withoutSpace.desc: Pure character count only. Often used when there are character limits for essays or applications.

bytes.title: Byte Calculation
bytes.desc: Size in UTF-8 encoding. Korean characters are 3 bytes, English/numbers are 1 byte each.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.q1: Q. How many bytes is one Korean character?
faq.a1: In UTF-8 encoding, one Korean character is 3 bytes. English letters, numbers, and basic special characters are 1 byte each.
faq.q2: Q. How are character limits calculated for applications?
faq.a2: Most applications use "characters with spaces" as the standard. However, some may use "without spaces", so check the requirements.
faq.q3: Q. How is the word count calculated?
faq.a3: Words are counted as units separated by spaces. Useful for checking word count in English essays.

info.title: What is JSON?
info.desc: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight data interchange format. It's easy for humans to read and write, and easy for machines to parse and generate. Widely used in web APIs and configuration files.

format.title: Format
format.desc: Beautify compressed JSON with proper indentation for better readability.

validate.title: Validate
validate.desc: Check if your JSON is syntactically correct and find errors.

minify.title: Minify
minify.desc: Remove whitespace to reduce file size for production use.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight text-based format for storing and transmitting data. It's easy for humans to read and machines to parse, widely used in web APIs and configuration files.
faq.q2: Q. What is a JSON formatter used for?
faq.a2: It's used to prettify compressed JSON for readability or to find and fix JSON syntax errors. Useful for API response analysis, config file editing, and data validation.
faq.q3: Q. What's the difference between JSON and JavaScript objects?
faq.a3: JSON is a string-based data format, while JavaScript objects are a programming language data type. In JSON, keys must be wrapped in double quotes, and functions or undefined cannot be values.

what.q: Q. What is a text diff tool?
what.a: A text diff tool finds and visually displays the differences between two texts line by line. It's widely used in programming to review code changes and in document work to compare versions.

privacy.q: Q. Is my text data safe?
privacy.a: Yes, all comparison operations are processed within your browser. The text you enter is not sent to any server, and all data is deleted when you close the page.

limits.q: Q. Are there any limits on text size?
limits.a: There are no specific limits, but very large texts (tens of thousands of lines) may process slower depending on your browser's performance.

meta.title: Ovulation Calculator | Fertile Window & Safe Period - Free Online
meta.description: Enter your last period date and cycle length to automatically calculate ovulation date, fertile window, and safe periods. View results on a visual calendar. Free online ovulation calculator.
meta.keywords: ovulation calculator, fertile window calculator, safe period calculator, ovulation date, pregnancy planning, menstrual cycle calculator, ovulation calendar, fertility tracker
meta.ogTitle: Ovulation Calculator | Fertile Window & Safe Period
meta.ogDescription: Enter your last period date and cycle length to instantly calculate ovulation day, fertile window, and safe periods with a visual calendar!

OvulationCalculator.title: Ovulation Calculator
OvulationCalculator.subtitle:
Enter your last period start date and cycle length
to automatically calculate your ovulation date, fertile window, and safe periods.

input.title: Enter Period Information
input.cycleDesc: * Typically 21-35 days, with an average of 28 days.
input.alertDate: Please enter your last period start date.
input.alertCycle: Please enter a cycle length between 20 and 45 days.

ovulation.title: üå∏ What is Ovulation?
ovulation.desc: Ovulation is the release of an egg from the ovary. It typically occurs 14 days before the next expected period. This calculator estimates the ovulation date based on this principle.

fertile.title: üî∂ Fertile Window
fertile.desc: The fertile window spans from 5 days before ovulation to 1 day after. Sperm can survive up to 5 days in the female body, and the egg survives about 12-24 hours after ovulation, making this the highest probability period for conception.

safe.title: üîµ Safe Period
safe.desc: The safe period refers to days outside the fertile window. It is divided into early (from period start to before fertile window) and late (after fertile window to before next period). However, it is not 100% safe, so use this information as a reference only.

caution.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Notice
caution.desc:
This calculator provides estimates based on regular menstrual cycles. Ovulation timing can vary due to stress, weight changes, illness, and other factors.
For accurate ovulation tracking, consider using ovulation test kits or consulting a gynecologist.
Do not use this as medical basis for contraception or pregnancy planning.

calculation.q: Q. How is the ovulation date calculated?
calculation.a: Ovulation typically occurs 14 days before the next expected period. For example, with a 28-day cycle, ovulation is expected around day 14 from the last period start date.

fertile.q: Q. When is the fertile window?
fertile.a: The fertile window spans from 5 days before ovulation to 1 day after, approximately 6-7 days total. Sperm can survive up to 5 days in the body, and an egg survives about 24 hours after ovulation.

irregular.q: Q. Can I use this with irregular cycles?
irregular.a: This calculator is based on regular menstrual cycles. For irregular cycles, use it as a reference only and consider ovulation test kits or consulting a gynecologist for accurate tracking.

safe.q: Q. Is the safe period really safe?
safe.a: The safe period has a relatively lower chance of pregnancy, but it is not 100% safe. Ovulation can vary from predictions, so relying solely on this for contraception is not recommended.

DutchPay.guideStep4Desc: See who owes whom, with the minimum number of transfers needed.

howTo.q: How do I use the bill splitting calculator?
howTo.a: Enter participant names and amounts each person paid. The calculator automatically determines who owes whom and how much.

difference.q: What is the difference between Equal Split and Custom Input?
difference.a: Equal Split divides the total evenly among all participants. Custom Input lets you enter the actual amount each person paid and calculates the differences.

multiple.q: Can I split bills among more than 3 people?
multiple.a: Yes, you can add as many participants as needed using the Add button. The calculator minimizes the number of transactions needed.

meaning.a: Dutch Pay means splitting the bill equally among all participants at a meal or gathering. It's also commonly called 'splitting the bill' or 'going Dutch'.

support.q: What SQL dialects does the formatter support?
support.a: It supports standard SQL syntax used in MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server, SQLite, and more. It can format SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE queries with JOINs and subqueries.

oneline.q: Can I format a single-line SQL from logs?
oneline.a: Yes, paste the single-line SQL query and click 'Format'. Keywords will be separated with line breaks and indentation for easy reading.

privacy.q: Is my SQL sent to any server?
privacy.a: No. All processing happens in your browser. Your SQL is never transmitted to any server.

uppercase.a: It automatically converts SQL keywords (SELECT, FROM, WHERE, etc.) to uppercase. This is a common convention to improve SQL readability.

CronGenerator.guideStep1Desc: A Cron expression consists of 5 fields (minute, hour, day, month, weekday), separated by spaces.
CronGenerator.guideStep2Desc: For each field, choose between 'Every (*)', 'Specific values', 'Range (1-5)', or 'Interval (*/5)'.
CronGenerator.guideStep3Desc: Click preset buttons for commonly used schedules to auto-fill all fields.
CronGenerator.guideStep4Desc: Check the generated Cron expression at the top and click 'Copy' to copy to clipboard.

dash.example: 0 9-17 * * * ‚Üí Run every hour from 9 AM to 5 PM

what.a: A Cron expression is a time-based scheduling format used in Linux/Unix systems to automate recurring tasks. It consists of 5 fields (minute, hour, day of month, month, day of week) using numbers and special characters to define execution timing.

range.q: What ranges do each Cron field accept?
range.a: Minute (0-59), Hour (0-23), Day of Month (1-31), Month (1-12), Day of Week (0-6, where 0=Sunday).

where.q: Where can I use the generated Cron expression?
where.a: You can use it in Linux crontab, Proxmox scheduler, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, AWS CloudWatch, Kubernetes CronJob, and most scheduling systems.

privacy.q: Is my data sent to any server?
privacy.a: No. All processing happens in your browser. No data is transmitted to any server.

guide.title: How to Use
guide.step1: Copy URL: Copy the URL of the YouTube video you want. (From address bar or share button)
guide.step2: Paste URL: Paste the URL in the input field above and click 'Extract'.
guide.step3: Download: Click 'Download' on your preferred quality to save the thumbnail image.

q1.q: Q. What YouTube URL formats are supported?
q1.a: All formats are supported: standard links (youtube.com/watch?v=...), short links (youtu.be/...), embed links (youtube.com/embed/...), and Shorts links (youtube.com/shorts/...).

q2.q: Q. Which thumbnail quality should I choose?
q2.a: We recommend Max Resolution (maxresdefault, 1280√ó720). Some videos may not offer the highest quality; in that case, use SD (640√ó480) or HQ (480√ó360).

q3.q: Q. Can I use thumbnails commercially?
q3.a: Thumbnail copyrights belong to the video creator. You can freely use them for personal reference, but commercial use requires permission from the original creator.

q4.q: Q. Is any data stored on the server?
q4.a: No, all processing happens in your browser. URLs you enter and images you download are never sent to or stored on any server.

meta.title: My IP Address Checker | Geolocation & ISP Info - Free Online
meta.description: Instantly check your public IP address with geolocation (country/city), ISP info, and map view. Auto-detected on page load. Free online IP lookup tool.
meta.keywords: my IP address, IP address checker, what is my IP, IP geolocation, public IP lookup, ISP info, IP location, find my IP, IP tracker
meta.ogTitle: My IP Address Checker | Location & ISP Info
meta.ogDescription: Instantly check your public IP address and approximate location. Auto-detected on page load!

IpAddress.title: My IP Address Checker
IpAddress.subtitle: Instantly check your public IP address and approximate location just by visiting this page.
IpAddress.mapDesc: This is an estimated location based on IP. Actual location may differ.

whatIs.title: What is an IP Address?
whatIs.desc: An IP address (Internet Protocol Address) is a unique numerical address assigned to every device connected to the internet. It enables data to be sent and received between devices.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.desc: This tool uses external APIs to look up IP information. No data is stored, and all information disappears when you close the page.

accuracy.title: Location Accuracy
accuracy.desc: IP-based geolocation can only determine city-level approximate locations. It may differ from your exact address. If using a VPN, the VPN server location will be shown.

IpAddress.guideStep1Desc: Your IP address and location are automatically detected when you visit the page. No input required.
IpAddress.guideStep2Desc: Click 'Copy IP' to copy your current IP address to the clipboard.
IpAddress.guideStep3Desc: Check approximate location details including country, region, city, coordinates, and ISP information.
IpAddress.guideStep4Desc: See the estimated IP-based location visually on the map below.

whatIs.a: An IP address (Internet Protocol Address) is a unique numerical address assigned to every device connected to the internet. It enables data to be sent and received across the network.

accuracy.a: IP-based geolocation can determine your approximate location (city level). It may differ from your exact street address or GPS coordinates, and may show your ISP's server location instead.

vpn.q: Does using a VPN change my IP?
vpn.a: Yes, when using a VPN, the VPN server's IP address is displayed instead of your real one. This hides your actual IP and location.

ipv6.q: What is the difference between IPv4 and IPv6?
ipv6.a: IPv4 uses 32-bit addresses (e.g., 192.168.0.1) providing about 4.3 billion addresses. IPv6 uses 128-bit addresses (e.g., 2001:0db8::1) providing virtually unlimited addresses.
